channel.title: Port blocked overnight?
channel.description:
I portforwarded yesterday, it all worked people could get on my server etc. now people cant, i checked my router page and the port should still be open, but when i use port checker it says error: connection timed out (failed to see your service at 43594)
anyone got a clue what happened? or how i fix this? windows firewall is turned off.

item.title: Port blocked overnight?
item.dc:creator: @x_pk3r_xx x pk3r xx
item.description:
@x_pk3r_xx wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:8, topic:401155”]…
Do you have a router?[/quote]

yeah, sitecom router, but when i go to router page i end up at telio SPA-2102, wich allows me to open ports etc.

[quote=“Rock N Rolla, post:9, topic:401155”][b]Do you have if external static ip?

If yes, I dont have a clue whats wrong.

If no, Search no-ip and get it.

SOLVED![/b][/quote]

I’ve got no-ip, the port seems to be blocked for no reason

It all worked yesterday.

e/ FOUND IT

thx for the help

Read full topic

item.title: Port blocked overnight?
item.dc:creator: @x_pk3r_xx x pk3r xx
item.description:
@x_pk3r_xx wrote:

[quote=“someone2, post:4, topic:401155”][quote author=x pk3r xx link=topic=498217.msg3643262#msg3643262 date=1309181733]
I dont think so.

it shows a current ip wan port, current ip lan port, and static ip wan port has a blank field
[/quote]
sigh

Configuration panel, go to classic view, internet connections (or something similiar, I’ve got it in another language), right-click, properties, press on internet protocol (don’t double click), properties. Is the first or second option checked?[/quote]

classic view? ive got windows 7… makes it hard lol

i cant find it

Read full topic

item.title: Port blocked overnight?

[quote=“x pk3r xx, post:3, topic:401155”]I dont think so.

it shows a current ip wan port, current ip lan port, and static ip wan port has a blank field[/quote]
sigh

Configuration panel, go to classic view, internet connections (or something similiar, I’ve got it in another language), right-click, properties, press on internet protocol (don’t double click), properties. Is the first or second option checked?
